intro: Helleborus cyclophyllus, commonly known as the cyclophyllous hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its dark green, palmate leaves and clusters of nodding, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments, often found in woodland areas. Its flowers typically bloom in late winter to early spring, making it one of the earliest flowering plants in the hellebore genus. Helleborus cyclophyllus is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
